thread.title: Researcher: Children's cancer linked to Fukushima radiation
thread.title_full: Researcher: Children's cancer linked to Fukushima radiation

title: Researcher: Children's cancer linked to Fukushima radiation
text: Researcher: Children's cancer linked to Fukushima radiation By Associated Press | October 8, 2015 @ 1:28 am \n FILE - In this March 15, 2011 file photo, a child is screened for radiation exposure at a testing center in Koriyama city, Fukushima Prefecture, northeast of Tokyo, after a nuclear power plant on the coast of the prefecture was damaged by March 11 earthquake. A new study says children living near the Fukushima nuclear meltdowns have been diagnosed with thyroid cancer at a rate 20 to 50 times that of children elsewhere, a difference the authors contend undermines the governmentâs position that more cases have been discovered in the area only because of stringent monitoring. Most of the 370,000 children in Fukushima have been given ultrasound checkups since the March 2011 meltdowns at the tsunami-ravaged Fukushima Dai-ichi nuclear plant. Thyroid cancer has been diagnosed in 137 of those children, though more broadly the disease occurs in only about one or two of every million children. (AP Photo/Wally Santana, File)\n
